content: freshman cabled socks by star athena sizes medium large foot circumference 7 9 inches 17 5 23 cm unstretched will stretch to fit 8 10 inches 20 25 5 cm needles 1 set us #1/2 25mm 32 circular needles magic loop 2 sets of 24 circulars 2 circ method or double pointed needles adjust needle sizes if necessary to obtain the correct gauge gauge 32 sts/48 row = 4 in st st one way to alter the size of this sock will be to change gauge for an 8 circumference sock work the small at 7 sts per inch or the large at 9 sts per inch yarn fingering-weight yarn that gives you proper gauge i m using lorna s laces shepherd sock 80% superwash wool 20% nylon 215 yd 197 m /50 g color chino 2 skeins notions tapestry needle cable needle notes i m really inspired by the way you can draw simple lines and geometric shapes with basic cables the design happens from the placement of the cables rather than the detail of the cable itself this project uses cables that are elongated and stacked in a spiraling angular design the left and right sock mirror each other for added interest these socks are like your freshman year in a new endeavor… jump in and get started this adventurous beginner pattern is worked from the cuff down the spiraling cable effect is created by alternating chart a and chart b when you complete chart a you work chart b then you return back to chart a and so on © 2010 star athena - all rights reserved 1 http //keeponknittinginthefreeworld blogspot com/ how to work cable chart with a cable needle c2 over 2 left slide 2 sts to cn and hold to the front k2 k2 from cn c2 over 2 right slide 2 sts to cn and hold to the back k2 k2 from cn how to work cable chart without a cable needle c2 over 2 left sl 4 sts to right needle insert the tip of the left needle into the first two sts slipped pull the right needle free of all sts and pick up the loose sts from the back put sts back on the left needle and knit each stitch c2 over 2 right sl 4 sts to right needle insert the tip of the left needle from behind into the first two sts slipped pull the right needle free of all sts and pick up the loose sts from the front put sts back on the left needle and knit each stitch abbreviations p2tog purl two stitches together as one cn cable needle stitch co cast on rs right or public side of work est established sl slip as in slip the next stitch from left to k knit right purl-wise ktbl knit through back loop ssk slip one stitch as if to knit slip the next k2tog knit two stitches together as one stitch as if to knit
